dlgPart.npc_text: "You really think you look good naked? Go put something on."

フォンは２０年前にキャラバンでテロンにやってきた。彼がどこから、そしてなぜここへ来たのかは誰も知らないが、失われた人生の記憶によって捻くれた男のような辛辣さがあった。彼は言語や古代の遺物に精通していたが、この町には既に考古学者がいた。フォンにとって幸いなことに、その考古学者は彼の症状に悩まされた錬金術士による最善の努力にもかかわらず、ほどなくして病気で亡くなった。その後すぐにフォンは新たな考古学者となり、多くのダラタンの遺物を発見した後はアンティダス卿の恩寵も得るようになった。
「何だ？」フォンは君の存在を認めると苛立ちながら答え、彼が調査していた何かの機械を置いた。

dlgAnsw.text: 「鑑定してもらえる<ka/mu>？」彼に商人の地図を見せる。
「ここで何の仕事をしている<nda/no>？」
"Cado sends his regards. We need your help in a delicate situation."

dlgPart.npc_text:
フォンは２０年前にキャラバンでテロンにやってきた。彼がどこから、そしてなぜここへ来たのかは誰も知らないが、失われた人生の記憶によって捻くれた男のような辛辣さがあった。彼は言語や古代の遺物に精通していたが、この町には既に考古学者がいた。フォンにとって幸いなことに、その考古学者は彼の症状に悩まされた錬金術士による最善の努力にもかかわらず、ほどなくして病気で亡くなった。その後すぐにフォンは新たな考古学者となり、多くのダラタンの遺物を発見した後はアンティダス卿の恩寵も得るようになった。
「私の粗末な住処では、アンティダス卿の執政官様はいつでも歓迎いたしますよ。我が主は何をご所望ですかな？ 何でもお言いつけくだされ」

dlgAnsw.text: 「これは何だと思う？」クラゲのアーティファクトを見せる。
「イブン・ハダット・アル・サラビのことを知っているか？」

dlgPart.npc_text: 「私は考古学者だ。つまり、私は学者であり、管理人であり、そして最も重要なのは、知識の商人であるということだ。この説明が複雑すぎるなら、そうだな、あんたの知性の欠如が痛々しいほどに明らかになった時に頼るべき者が私だということだ。で、もう一度聞くが何のご用かな？」

dlgAnsw.text: 「鑑定してもらえる<ka/mu>？」彼に商人の地図を見せる。
"Cado sends his regards. We need your help in a delicate situation."

dlgPart.npc_text: 「あぁ、<charname>。入って、入って。今日は私めに何のご用かな？」

dlgAnsw.text: [streetwise success]"The Eye is a fake, isn't it?"
[lore success]"The Eye is a fake, isn't it?"
"Cado sends his regards. He needs your help in a delicate situation."
"I still need a document with Antidas' seal and signature."
"I have the money for the documents."
「はい、ソー・アゴスの眼の分のお金」１００インペリアル払う。
"Here is the money for the ring." Pay 100 imperials.
"What do you think this is?" Show him the jellyfish artefact.
"Have you heard about Ibn Hadad al-Sarabi?"
"About your problem with Cassius... How much will you pay me?"

dlgPart.npc_text: 「私めに何のご用かな？」

dlgAnsw.text: [streetwise success]"The Eye is a fake, isn't it?"
[lore success]"The Eye is a fake, isn't it?"
"Cado sends his regards. He needs your help in a delicate situation."
"I still need a document with Antidas' seal and signature."
"I have the money for the documents."
"Here is the money for the Eye of Thor-Agoth." Pay 100 imperials.
"Here is the money for the ring." Pay 100 imperials.
"What do you think this is?" Show him the jellyfish artefact.
"Have you heard about Ibn Hadad al-Sarabi?"
"About your problem with Cassius... How much will you pay me?"

dlgPart.npc_text:
「今度はなんだ？ 本来なら訪問ごとに金を取るべきなんだろうが、私は優しすぎるようだな。そしていつも利用される」フォンはため息をつく。
「何の用だ、<charname>？ 手短にな」

dlgAnsw.text: "Can you appraise something for me?" Show him the trader's map.
"Cado sends his regards. We need your help in a delicate situation."
"I still need a document with Antidas' seal and signature."
"Here is the money. Now tell me about the map." Pay 50 imperials.
"Here is the money. Now tell me about the map." Pay 25 imperials.
"Here is the money. What else can you tell me about the map?" Pay 20 imperials.
"Here is the money. Now tell me who is interested in the map." Pay 20 imperials.
"Here is the money for the Eye of Thor-Agoth." Pay 100 imperials.
"I have the money for the documents."
"Here is the money for the ring." Pay 100 imperials.
"What do you think this is?" Show him the jellyfish artefact.
"Have you heard about Ibn Hadad al-Sarabi?"
"About your problem with Cassius... How much will you pay me?"

dlgPart.npc_text: "What do you want, <charname>? Make it quick."

dlgAnsw.text: "Can you appraise something for me?" Show him the trader's map.
"Cado sends his regards. We need your help in a delicate situation."
"I still need a document with Antidas' seal and signature."
"Here is the money. Now tell me about the map." Pay 50 imperials.
"Here is the money. Now tell me about the map." Pay 25 imperials.
"Here is the money. What else can you tell me about the map?" Pay 20 imperials.
"Here is the money. Now tell me who is interested in the map." Pay 20 imperials.
"Here is the money for the Eye of Thor-Agoth." Pay 100 imperials.
"I have the money for the documents."
"Here is the money for the ring." Pay 100 imperials.
"What do you think this is?" Show him the jellyfish artefact.
"Have you heard about Ibn Hadad al-Sarabi?"
"About your problem with Cassius... How much will you pay me?"

dlgPart.npc_text: "Ah, my friend. What can I do for you today?"

dlgAnsw.text: "Cado sends his regards. He needs your help in a delicate situation."
"I have the money for the documents."
"What do you think this is?" Show him the jellyfish artefact.
"Have you heard about Ibn Hadad al-Sarabi?"

dlgPart.npc_text: "What can I do for you, my friend?"

dlgAnsw.text: "Cado sends his regards. He needs your help in a delicate situation."
"I have the money for the documents."
"What do you think this is?" Show him the jellyfish artefact.
"Have you heard about Ibn Hadad al-Sarabi?"

dlgPart.npc_text: "What is it, apprentice?"

dlgAnsw.text: "Do you have anything else for me to do?"
"What do you think this is?" Show him the prospector's amulet.
"What do you think this is?" Show him the jellyfish artefact.
"Cado sends his regards. He needs your help in a delicate situation."
"I still need a document with Antidas' seal and signature."
"I have the money for the documents."
"Have you heard about Ibn Hadad al-Sarabi?"
"Do you think it will ever get better?"
“I saw an old orrery at Thessalos’ house today. According to it, there was a full planetary alignment just before the war. I was wondering –”

dlgPart.npc_text: 「私の粗末な住処では、アンティダス卿の執政官様はいつでも歓迎いたしますよ。我が主は何をご所望ですかな？ 何でもお言いつけくだされ」

dlgAnsw.text: 「<omae/anata>はどこからやって来た<nda/no>、フォン？」
"What do you think this is?" Show him the jellyfish artefact.
"Have you heard about Ibn Hadad al-Sarabi?"
「カシウスはもう問題ではなくなった<mu/wa>」
"Here is the money for the ring." Pay 100 imperials.

dlgPart.npc_text: "What would you like to know, praetor?"

dlgAnsw.text: "What do you think this is?" Show him the jellyfish artefact.
"Have you heard about Ibn Hadad al-Sarabi?"
"Your services are no longer required, Feng."
「カシウスはもう問題ではなくなった<mu/wa>」
"Here is the money for the ring." Pay 100 imperials.

dlgPart.npc_text: END

「賢い選択だな。大体の人間は、貴重なアイテムをその価値に気付かずに売ってしまうんだ。どれ……これは……信じられん！ そんな……」 フォンは驚いた様子で地図を置いた。
「これは、極めて貴重なアーティファクトだ。調査できることを光栄に思うよ。だが費用は５０インペリアル要るな」

dlgAnsw.text: [streetwise success]「落ち着、フォン。この貴重なアーティファクトのことは農夫に任せて、妥当な価格について話し合」
[grifter][streetwise success]「落ち着、フォン。からかわないで。この貴重なアーティファクトのことは農夫に任せて、妥当な価格について話し合」
[trading success]"50 imperials? If you are as good as you are greedy, I'm in luck. 20 coins and I will forget the insult."
[lore success]"It's an antique map with the seal of Thor-Agoth. That much I can figure out on my own. If you can tell me more than that, I'll gladly pay you 50 imperials. Otherwise..."

dlgPart.npc_text: 「さっきも言ったように、これは極めて貴重なアーティファクトなんだ。調査できることを光栄に思うが、費用は５０インペリアル要るぞ」

dlgAnsw.text: [streetwise success]「落ち着、フォン。この貴重なアーティファクトのことは農夫に任せて、妥当な価格について話し合」
[grifter][streetwise success]「落ち着、フォン。からかわないで。この貴重なアーティファクトのことは農夫に任せて、妥当な価格について話し合」
[trading success]"50 imperials? If you are as good as you are greedy, I'm in luck. 20 coins and I will forget the insult."
[lore success]"It's an antique map with the seal of Thor-Agoth. That much I can figure out on my own. If you can tell me more than that, I'll gladly pay you 50 imperials. Otherwise..."

dlgPart.npc_text:
「これはソー・アゴスの伝説の地図だ。マギのアーティファクトへの道を示している。戦争が終わった後、悪人の手に渡らぬようにと埋められたアーティファクトだ。話には聞いたことがあったが、まさか自分がこの地図を手にする日が来るとは思わなかったぞ」フォンは拡大鏡を取り出す。
「下の方に象形文字で何か書かれているな。”ソー・アゴスの眼が道を示すだろう”」彼はゆっくりと読み上げる。「ソー・アゴスの眼……」フォンは囁き、目を見開いて君を見た。彼はチェストを漁り、何かを探し始めた。─大きな、円い、金で縁取られた三色の水晶。その中心は真っ黒で、まるで目のように見える。
「大分前に西の廃墟でこれを見つけてな。柔らかく輝き、触ると温かかった。そうやってこの宝石は導いてくれるのだ─近づけば近づくほどに、より輝きを増していく。さて、私はもう年だから一緒には行けないが、１００インペリアルでこの眼を貸してやるぞ。あんたなら、マギの宝を見つけて持ち帰ってきてくれるだろうな」

onLoadScripts.string: if(aod.npc_feng_pay_50) {dlgChangeMoney(-50); dlgAddTextBoxMessage("君は５０インペリアル払った");}
if(aod.npc_feng_pay_25) {dlgChangeMoney(-25); dlgAddTextBoxMessage("君は２５インペリアル払った");}
if(aod.npc_feng_noPrice) {dlgChangeMoney(-50); dlgAddTextBoxMessage("君は５０インペリアル払った");}

dlgPart.npc_text:
フォンは君が払ったお金を二回数えてから、君の首にソー・アゴスの眼を丁寧にかける。この水晶は重くて温かい。君は何故かいつもと違う感じがした。
「持って帰ってくるのを忘れるなよ」フォンは念を押し、しぶしぶと水晶を手放す。「アンティダス卿と話しなさい。どうしたらいいかわかるだろうよ」

onLoadScripts.string: dlgAddTextBoxMessage("君は１００インペリアル払った");
dlgAddTextBoxMessage("ソー・アゴスの眼を手に入れた");

dlgPart.npc_text:
"Lord, may you confirm your royal position by taking your seat on the throne! May you strengthen the foundations of your throne by grasping the divine powers and inspiring awe...," you read aloud and look at Feng.
Feng puts the 'Eye' away disappointingly. "Show the map to Lord Antidas," he says in a different tone. "He collects old things."

「この地図は眼がなければ価値はないぞ。眼がなければ、神殿も見つけられん！ 私が信じられないというなら、アンティダス卿に聞いてみるがいい」
「金が必要なら、きっと解決できるぞ。ちょっとした問題があってな。なかなか都合が悪いことなんだ、本当に」
「アンティダス卿がテロンに別の考古学者を招いたんだ。言うまでもないが、私は一人より二人の方が良いという彼の意見に賛同できん。もしあんたが、その考古学者をどうにかして消してくれるなら大変にありがたい。彼の名はカシウス。もう宿にいるだろうから、時間を無駄にせんでくれ」

dlgAnsw.text: 「ありがたいとは、どれぐらい<da/>？」

dlgPart.npc_text: Feng chuckles. "Alright. We'll leave the act for farmers then. It's a very old map of this region. I wouldn't pay 10 coins for it, but I know someone who will give you at least 100 imperials. That's what you'll pay me 20 imperials for. Do we have a deal?"

dlgAnsw.text: "Here is the money. What else can you tell me about the map?"

dlgPart.npc_text: [success]"25 and we have a deal."

dlgAnsw.text: "Here is the money. Now tell me about the map."

dlgPart.npc_text: "For 20 imperials I will send you to someone who can tell you a lot more about it, and pay you well for your trouble. Trust me, it's the real deal. Now, what do you say?"

"Show the map to Lord Antidas. He collects old things.
「行く前に一つ頼みがある。アンティダス卿がテロンに別の考古学者を招いておってな。私としては仲間の考古学者と一緒に働くのは歓迎なんだが、カシウス─新しい考古学者─はそれを許容できずに私を追い出すだろう。私は嘆願するには年を取り過ぎた。だがあんたに頼みたいんだ。私のためにカシウスを排除してくれ。報酬ははずむぞ。」
「奴はもう宿にいるだろう。時間を無駄にしないでくれ」
「じゃあ、用意できたら戻ってきなさい」

"Not much to tell you, to be honest." Feng's smirk suggests that being honest is simply something he isn't good at.
"The map bears the seal of Thor-Agoth the Artificer, one of the High Lords. I assume that's his temple in the middle. That's all I can really tell you. Talk to Antidas, if you want to know more."

"You've heard about the war with the Qantari at least? You know, the one that turned this entire continent into a wasteland? It is said that during the war both sides summoned supernatural allies from other planes of existence, if you believe in such nonsense. Many loremasters will tell you that the Qantari summoned demons from fiery pits of the underworld, while we, of course, summoned gods from some heavenly abode, but the truth is that nobody knows what really happened. What we do know for sure is that the Empire crumbled and fell, leaving us ruins, a handful of towns, and stories to scare our children with."

dlgAnsw.text: "Fascinating. I'll go pay lord Antidas a visit then. It goes without saying that if he doesn't pay me, I'll be back to finish our conversation."

dlgPart.npc_text: END - Cassius quest considered
「この忠実な僕が、我らが主をそこまで不快にさせたというのですか？」フォンは芝居がかった口調で尋ねた。「多くの者の理解を超えたことを、誰が我らが主に助言できると？ 誰が見知らぬ危険から彼を守るというんです？」
「若造のカシウス？ 彼が何を知っていると？ 何十年もの間、古代の資料を研究し、全ての単語に至るまで精読し、その意味を熟考しなければならないんだぞ。何十年もだ、執政官よ！ あんたまさか彼がそんな重要な仕事に向いてるなんて言うんじゃないだろうな」

dlgAnsw.text: 「私がどう思っているかは関係ない<mu/wa>」

dlgPart.npc_text: 「関係ないだと？ あんたは執政官であって、女中じゃないんだぞ。もしアンティダス卿がその偉大なる叡智でもって恐ろしい過ちを犯してしまったとしたら？ それを正し、彼の幸福を保証することが貴官の責務ではないのか？」

dlgAnsw.text: 「主の意志に逆らえというの<ka/mu>？」

dlgPart.npc_text: 「あんたは学ぶべきことがたくさんあるな、<charname>。賢くやればかなりのことができるんだぞ。例えば、カシウスが消えたら？ それで全ての問題が解決するのではないか？」

dlgAnsw.text: 「もしも、の話。私がカシウスが失踪した知らせを持ってきたら、金のシャワーを浴びせてくれる<n/mu><dayona/none>？」

dlgPart.npc_text: 「私が？ 私は我らが主の最も謙虚な僕で、彼の決定に疑問を抱く立場ではない」

dlgAnsw.text: 「<daga/demo>、もし私が<omae/anata>のために疑問を抱いたら、私に金のシャワーを浴びせてくれるん<darou/desyou>？」

dlgPart.npc_text: 「私が裕福な人間だったらそうしていただろうな。だが残念ながらそうではない。それでも、１００インペリアルなら用意できるだろうよ」

dlgAnsw.text: [trading success]「<omae/anata>にとってこの仕事の価値はそれだけなの<ka/mu>？ 全く評価していないんだなと思えてきた<ga/kedo>」

dlgPart.npc_text: 「２５０インペリアルだ、執政官。やってこい」
END - Cassius quest taken Praetor
END - Cassius quest refused Praetor

"Wait! You look like a capable <man/woman>. There is a small matter I'd like to talk to you about. Lord Antidas has invited another loremaster to Teron. Needless to say, I don't share his opinion that two heads are better than one, and I'll be very grateful if you can find a way to get rid of the new loremaster.
"His name is Cassius. He's probably at the inn already, so don't waste any time."

「行く前に一つ頼みがある、<charname>。アンティダス卿がテロンに別の考古学者を招いておってな。私としては仲間の考古学者と一緒に働くのは歓迎なんだが、カシウス─新しい考古学者─はそれを許容できずに私を追い出すだろう。私は嘆願するには年を取り過ぎた。だがあんたに頼みたいんだ。私のためにカシウスを排除してくれ。報酬ははずむぞ。」
「奴はもう宿にいるだろう。時間を無駄にしないでくれ」
「５０インペリアル」

dlgAnsw.text: [trading]「新しい考古学者が住み着いたら<omae/anata>はどうするんだろうな。その年で物乞いを始めるのは難しいと聞いたことがある<ga/kedo>」
[assassin]「<ore/watashi>のギルドなら少なくとも１００インペリアルは請求する<yo/><mu/wa>。そして<ore/watashi>の取り分は７５」

dlgPart.npc_text: [success]「わかった、わかった。倍払おう。１００インペリアルだ。さっさと終わらせてくれ」
[failure]「わかった。６０インペリアルだ。さっさと終わらせてくれ」
「わかった、わかった。７５インペリアルだ。さっさと終わらせてくれ」
END - Cassius quest taken 50 reward
END - Cassius quest taken more reward

"So, young Cassius is gone and will bother us no more. Good riddance, I say. Such a pompous ass that boy was. Well, I owe you a lot more than what I paid you - you must forgive an old man his habits - and I'd like you to have this." Feng carefully unwraps a small bundle and gives you a ring.
It's a heavy silver ring covered with softly glowing runes. While the metal feels cold to touch, the glowing runes burn your fingertips. "It's the famous magic ring of general Galbo," explains Feng. "The ring was crafted by the Council of Magi to grant the general special powers, which made him unstoppable in battle. After the general's death, the ring was thought to be lost and hasn't been seen for centuries. It is, without a doubt, one of the most important relics of the Empire, and its reappearance is a great omen!"

dlgAnsw.text: [alchemy success]"What did you use? Zinc sulphide? Phosphorus?"

dlgPart.npc_text: "Evidently, it makes people stupid." Feng sighs and continues. "As I was saying, the ring had changed many hands until it was somehow acquired by your great grandfather. Since you are, quite obviously, unworthy of possessing such an artefact, you've decided to offer it to Lord Antidas, who, as everyone knows, is the one and only true son of the Empire, as a tribute. With me so far?"
"Very well then." Feng gives you the ring.

Feng sighs again. "I made this ring a few days ago. I copied the runes from an old manuscript and filled them with an alchemical component. It glows in poorly lit areas and will burn your fingers to the bone if you aren't careful. When you finally meet Lord Antidas - I suppose I could take you to see him, but it would be too suspicious - you'll offer the ring as a tribute without asking for anything in return. I'll confirm that the ring is authentic and will recommend his Lordship to reward your dedication to House Daratan. Then I'll start a lengthy and expensive research aimed at unlocking the ring's powers, but that's a different story. Do you get it now?"

"So, young Cassius is gone and will bother us no more. Good riddance, I say. Such a pompous ass that boy was. Here is the money I promised. But I owe you a lot more than what I paid you - you must forgive an old man his habits, so I'd like you to take a look at this," Feng carefully unwraps a small bundle and shows you a ring.
It's a heavy silver ring covered with softly glowing runes. While the metal feels cold to touch, the glowing runes burn your fingertips. "It's the famous magic ring of general Galbo," explains Feng. "The ring was crafted by the Council of Magi to grant the general special powers, which made him unstoppable in battle. After the general's death, the ring was thought to be lost and hasn't been seen for centuries. It is, without a doubt, one of the most important relics of the Empire, and its reappearance is a great omen!
"I'd give it to you for free, but I'm a poor old man. One hundred imperials is all I'm asking for it."
"The ring is yours, <charname>. I can tell that you are destined for great things."

"You have an inquisitive mind," nods Feng. "We must always seek logical explanations first, and then and only then should we consider the supernatural ones.
"So, as I was saying, the ring had changed many hands until it was somehow acquired by your great grandfather. Since you are, quite obviously, unworthy of possessing such an artefact, you've decided to offer it to Lord Antidas, who, as everyone knows, is the true and only son of the Empire, as a tribute. With me so far?"

"So, young Cassius is gone and will bother us no more. Good riddance, I say. Such a pompous ass that boy was. Here is the money I promised. But I owe you a lot more than what I paid you - you must forgive an old man his habits, so I'd like you to take a look at this," Feng carefully unwraps a small bundle and shows you a ring.
It's a heavy silver ring covered with softly glowing runes. While the metal feels cold to touch, the glowing runes burn your fingertips. "It's the famous magic ring of general Galbo," explains Feng. "The ring was crafted by the Council of Magi to grant the general special powers, which made him unstoppable in battle. After the general's death, the ring was thought to be lost and hasn't been seen for centuries. It is, without a doubt, one of the most important relics of the Empire, and its reappearance is a great omen!
"I'd give it to you for free, but I'm a poor old man. One hundred imperials is all I'm asking for it."
END - ring taken
END - ring refused
"Does he?" says Feng without any enthusiasm.

dlgAnsw.text: "I need a document with Antidas' seal and signature."

dlgPart.npc_text: "Unfortunately," Feng smiles dryly, "I do not have such a document. I wish I could help you, I really do, but..."

dlgAnsw.text: [trading success]"I'm not asking you to borrow it. Name your price, Feng."

[streetwise]"I understand. I really do. Now, Cado, on the other hand, might not. He might feel personally insulted. He might even feel that a lesson is in order. Believe me, it's not what I would call a desirable outcome."

dlgPart.npc_text: "Anything for you, <charname>," smiles Feng. "What can be more rewarding than helping a friend, eh?"

dlgAnsw.text: "I need a document with Antidas' seal and signature."

dlgPart.npc_text: "Anything for you, <charname>," smiles Feng. "What can be more rewarding than helping a hero such as yourself, eh?"

dlgAnsw.text: "I need a document with Antidas' seal and signature."

dlgPart.npc_text: [failure]"I'd love to stay and chat but I have a busy day."

dlgAnsw.text: [trading success]"Are you saying that you're no longer interested in gold? I'm not asking you to borrow it. Name your price, Feng."

dlgPart.npc_text: [success]"Alright. 100 imperials and the document is yours."
[success]"Alright. 50 imperials and the document is yours."
"It's your lucky day, <charname>. 100 imperials and the document is yours."
"It's your lucky day, <charname>. 50 imperials and the document is yours."
"It's your lucky day, <charname>. 25 imperials and the document is yours."
"Splendid. Let's see it."

dlgAnsw.text: "Sorry, looks like I'm a bit short." Leave.

dlgPart.npc_text: Feng carefully counts the coins and then hands you a document. It's a letter to Lord Gaelius regarding a territorial dispute. What it was doing in Feng's possession is unclear.

onLoadScripts.string: if(aod.quest_tg1_fengPay100) {dlgChangeMoney(-100); dlgAddTextBoxMessage("君はフォンに１００インペリアル払った");}
if(aod.quest_tg1_fengPay50) {dlgChangeMoney(-50); dlgAddTextBoxMessage("君はフォンに５０インペリアル払った");}
if(aod.quest_tg1_fengPay25) {dlgChangeMoney(-25); dlgAddTextBoxMessage("君はフォンに２５インペリアル払った");}

dlgPart.npc_text:
"Fake? I paid twenty five imperials for the stone! Have you seen anything like it before? It does have very unusual properties and even a blind fool can tell that it was formed under extraordinarily rare geologic conditions, but since you're too ignorant to appreciate this fact, I will gladly take the stone off your hands. Or give you *some* of your money back and you can keep it.
"What's it going to be?"

dlgAnsw.text: "I'll keep the stone. Now give me some money back."

dlgPart.npc_text: "A wise choice, <charname>. You won't regret it." Feng counts thirty five imperials, looks at you, sighs, counts another fifteen, and reluctantly gives you fifty imperials.
Feng takes back the stone, carefully studies it for wear and tear, finds nothing to complain about it, and reluctantly gives you your money back.

"Interesting," Feng mutters under his breath after studying the device. He gives it back to you and then goes through his collection of scrolls until he finds the one he's looking for. It has a drawing of a man in what appears to be some kind of underground chamber. There are wavy lines radiating upwards and two bodies lying on the floor. The man is holding the amulet to his mouth. The drums on the amulet appear to be glowing.
"It's a breathing apparatus. Or it *was* a breathing apparatus when magic was flowing through it."
"Sure, it can. All you have to do is cast a magic spell."

"Ah, the impatience of youth... Good planning takes time and thought. If I'm too slow for you, you're more than welcome to find yourself another master. Hmm... this is actually not a bad idea. I can only teach you so much and you need all the help you can get."

"You can learn something new from any of them, but with Carrinas you may get more than you bargained for. He's a man with a vision. Now, vision alone doesn't make a man dangerous, but throw in troops drilled to follow orders without question and you have a recipe for a perfect storm. Getting caught in a storm would be most unwise, especially for a loremaster.
"Linos is your best bet. He runs the merchants guild. If scheming and plotting aren't exciting enough for you though, talk to Cado of the Forty Thieves' fame. It won't be boring, that's for sure, and you may even live long enough to learn a thing or two."
END - go to MG
END - go to TG

Feng studies the artefact for a while, then shrugs and passes it back to you.
"My best guess, for all the good it'll do you, is that it's a part of a larger mechanism. The Magi had hundreds, if not thousands of strange devices. We know little of them, but perhaps it's for the best."

"It is an artefact of the Old Empire. No questions about it. Very rare and very valuable!
"I'll be honored to research it for you, of course. Since you're a repeat customer, I'll give you a discount. Twenty five coins is a fair price, I think."

Feng studies the artefact for a while, nodding to himself before passing it back to you.
"Yes, I've seen those before. It's a summoning artefact. With the right words, you could open up a rift between the worlds and call an otherworldly creature to come to ours. Judging by the shape, which I assume is purely decorative; it can call a giant jellyfish – a creature not of sea, but of air.
"Imagine it in all its alien beauty, floating up in the sky and searching for prey with its tentacles. What a terrifying sight it must have been. You're holding a real treasure in your hand, <charname>."
"The heavenly kingdom of Zhin, where else?"
"The locals are convinced that their Empire had conquered what they call the known world. I can assure you that is not the case, although they did do their best to turn it into a wasteland."
[charisma failure]Anger flares in Feng's eyes, but he manages to control himself. "It was so long ago, I can hardly remember," he says with a fake smile.

[charisma success]Anger flares in Feng's eyes, but he manages to control himself. He glances at you, considering something, and finally says, "I was exiled.
"I was young when it happened. Young and foolish. My father's connections had secured me a position at the palace and I thought my future was all but certain." A smirk crosses his lips. "Nothing is ever certain in Zhin.
"Zhin is civilized. They don't embarrass the old families by killing their offspring or sending them to rot in dungeons. They send them away for their missteps." He looks away for a moment. "I was given the title of court cartographer and told to depart without delay. The maps had to be verified and updated – a task of great importance that was given the highest priority overnight."

[loremaster background]Anger flares in Feng's eyes, but he manages to control himself. He glances at you, considering something, and finally says, "I was exiled.
"I was young when it happened. Young and foolish. My father's connections had secured me a position at the palace and I thought my future was all but certain." A smirk crosses his lips. "Nothing is ever certain in Zhin.
"Zhin is civilized. They don't embarrass the old families by killing their offspring or sending them to rot in dungeons. They send them away for their missteps." He looks away for a moment. "I was given the title of court cartographer and told to depart without delay. The maps had to be verified and updated – a task of great importance that was given the highest priority overnight."
"You don't refuse such high honour and live. Even a fool like me knew that."

"Next? I was given three men marked for death to accompany me on my journey. They robbed me and ran away a few days after we left Zhin. It took me almost a year to reach Maadoran. The journey had been most ... enlightening.
"Our philosophers teach us that men are inherently and fundamentally evil, but can be guided toward goodness with strict laws. I was skeptical when I first heard it, but my journey made me a believer.
"It showed me life for what it was - a daily struggle to survive. We cling to our lives from the day we're born for as long as we can. No cost is too great if it buys you yet another day."

dlgAnsw.text: "There is more to life than this."
"So, how did you end up here?"

dlgPart.npc_text: "Is there? And how would you know that, <master/mistress> <charname>?"

dlgAnsw.text: "Because we are not animals. Our thoughts, our minds are capable of so much more..."
"The men who built the Empire were different. They did something with their lives."

dlgPart.npc_text: "Ah... The "it has to be" argument. Do you lack the courage to see this town for what it truly is? Only a child would hide from the "evils" of the world behind naïve hopes and dreams. We are what we are and nothing will ever change that."

dlgAnsw.text: "We are not animals. Our thoughts, our minds are capable of so much more..."
"The men who built the Empire were different. They did something with their lives."
"So, how did you end up here?"

dlgPart.npc_text: "Indeed. Animals aren't sophisticated enough to kill for sport, to enslave, to torture, to pillage and plunder. We should be proud to call ourselves civilized, should we not, <master/mistress> <charname>?"

dlgAnsw.text: "The men who built the Empire were different. They did something with their lives."
"So, how did you end up here?"

dlgPart.npc_text: "A man who lives in a cave clings to his existence by making weapons, fighting off wild animals, and learning to control fire. A man who lives in a palace clings to his existence by gathering armies, conquering nations that oppose him, and learning to control magic. Do you *really* see the difference?"

dlgAnsw.text: "We are not animals. Our thoughts, our minds are capable of so much more..."
"So, how did you end up here?"

dlgPart.npc_text: "My master was killed and I had to leave everything again. This time I didn't waste any time though." The memories conjure a thin smile on Feng's lips.

dlgAnsw.text: "I think I've heard a story about the previous loremaster getting miraculously sick and dying within days of your arrival."

dlgPart.npc_text: "Most unfortunate."

"Master Enarion. He was a foreigner, like me. He took me in, taught me how to work with artefacts, how to read people. He had a nose for artefacts; it's like he knew where to look. He even dared to venture inside the Abyss. That's why he got killed. See, the Abyss always claims its victim, one way or another."

"You've never heard of the Abyss? They say that during the war the Qantari Magi had cast a spell so horrible it took a bite out of the city, vaporizing an entire district. You can still see the crater and the ruins, but if you get close enough, the magic will turn your guts inside out. They say the very laws of nature have been twisted, which is why nothing grows or lives there."

"He wasn't the only one. Many people made a living scavenging minor oddities and artefacts. It makes you sick, but if you don't go too far, you'll be ok. Enarion managed to go farther than anyone else. Made good coin selling what he'd found there too."
"Rumors told of a map in his possession. I guess someone wanted it bad enough. Only they didn't find it there so they came after me instead. I left Maadoran that very night."

dlgAnsw.text: "So, you've never found the map either?"

dlgPart.npc_text: "I've never had any desire to go back, just like I've never had any desire to go into the Abyss, with or without the map. After so many years I wouldn't even know where to look. Enarion told me before he died that his name was the key, but the key to what?"
"As I said, he was a foreigner. His real name was Einar."

dlgAnsw.text: "Is there anything you can teach me, master Feng?"

dlgPart.npc_text:
"Well, you did help me... I'm not sure I can teach you Lore - it's too complicated a subject, but I can certainly broaden your horizons when it comes to dealing with people. Listen closely..."
Feng spends some time teaching you how to read people, figure out what they want, and influence their decisions.

"Who hasn't? Storytellers compete with each other inventing new tales every year. Ibn Hadad was a magus, and not just any magus, but the first of their lot, which means that anything goes. No tale is too fanciful, apparently."

"What do I think? The Empire collapsed on his watch, that's what I think. All his vast powers weren't enough to stop it. In the stories, Ibn Hadad outsmarts the demons, overcomes all challenges, and always saves the day. Unfortunately, the world we live in is a testament to the fact that he was just a man. Like the rest of us, he could only do so much."

"What a foolish question," says Feng, shaking his head. "Life is never easy. It wasn't easy a hundred years ago, it's not easy today, and I can guarantee you a hundred years from now it still won't be easy. Some people always have it hard, and others always have it easy.
"Anyway, if you have plenty of food on your table and gold in your pockets, life isn't so bad, is it now? I came to Teron with nothing. I could have joined the beggars at the plaza and complained all day long, but I didn't. So, take it from me, <charname> - don't waste your time thinking about tomorrow. Focus on the task at hand and things will get better before you know it."

dlgAnsw.text: "You were lucky, master. If you didn't find those Daratan relics or if the old loremaster didn't die, you might have ended up at the plaza whether you wanted to or not."

dlgPart.npc_text: "Luck," says Feng with dignity, "had nothing to do with it."

“If it had anything to do with the war? Don’t be daft. The planets travel in circles, so every now and then some of them align. Two-planet alignments are common as dirt, while the so-called great alignment is the rarest and most magnificent of events. Still, it’s nothing but a natural event - no more significant than the blooming of a rare flower. Of course, the magi were all over it, but they were always obsessed with otherworldly energies.”
“I can’t say, not being a magus myself,” smirks Feng. “Something about wells.”

dlgAnsw.text: “Wells? What do the alignments have to do with wells?”

dlgPart.npc_text: “Not wells you draw water from. Mystical wells that can’t be seen with the naked eye. Wells large enough to swallow celestial bodies whole! Can you imagine such a thing? Ah, why am I wasting time on you? Go do something useful.”

dlgAnsw.text: [intelligence]“Gravity wells? They wanted to tap into the gravity wells?”

dlgPart.npc_text: “Gravity, yes. That is indeed the word I was looking for,” says Feng sourly. “Although mystical works just fine, if you ask me. Now, if you are clever enough to know fancy words, why do you pester me with questions?”
